channel.title: W3C Web Platform Working Group-relevant MDN issues
channel.description: Issue filed on MDN Web Docs related to pages attached to technologies developed by W3C Web Platform Working Group

item.title: [WebIDL-1] Fix `NotSupportedError` exceptions
item.content:encoded:
The way we described DOM Exceptions is inconsistent.

Some pages use tables, some pages use lists. Also, we want to indicate that these NotSupportedErrorare DOMException object of a given type.

The right way of doing this is to have an Exceptions paragraph with a <dl> list, like this:

### Exceptions
- `NotSupportedError` {{domxref("DOMException")}}
  - : Thrown if …

The goal here is to go through the list of pages below and, for each of them, to be sure that the exception section is in the adequate format. If the NotSupportedError is inside the text, make sure that it is followed by {{domxref("DOMException")}} so the reader is aware of it.

  • files/en-us/web/api/mediastream_image_capture_api/index.md
  • files/en-us/web/api/xrsession/requesthittestsource/index.md
  • files/en-us/web/api/xrsession/index.md
  • files/en-us/web/api/xrsession/updaterenderstate/index.md
  • files/en-us/web/api/xrsession/requestreferencespace/index.md
  • files/en-us/web/api/xrsession/requestlightprobe/index.md
  • files/en-us/web/api/xrsession/requesthittestsourcefortransientinput/index.md
  • files/en-us/web/api/elementinternals/reportvalidity/index.md
  • files/en-us/web/api/elementinternals/setformvalue/index.md
  • files/en-us/web/api/elementinternals/setvalidity/index.md

  • files/en-us/web/api/range/compareboundarypoints/index.md
  • files/en-us/web/api/mediarecordererrorevent/error/index.md
  • files/en-us/web/api/rtcpeerconnection/generatecertificate/index.md
  • files/en-us/web/api/web_animations_api/using_the_web_animations_api/index.md
  • files/en-us/web/api/navigator/clearappbadge/index.md

  • files/en-us/web/api/navigator/requestmediakeysystemaccess/index.md
  • files/en-us/web/api/xrsystem/requestsession/index.md

  • files/en-us/web/api/customelementregistry/define/index.md
  • files/en-us/web/api/remoteplayback/prompt/index.md
  • files/en-us/web/api/sourcebuffer/changetype/index.md
  • files/en-us/web/api/remoteplayback/watchavailability/index.md
  • files/en-us/web/api/audiocontext/audiocontext/index.md

  • files/en-us/mozilla/firefox/releases/51/index.html

If you want to work on this, and are not used to the format, feel free to make a PR for one of the files, and we'll review it. Also, you don't need to do 1 big PR but can break this down in pieces (although, here, larger PRs are easier to review).

Thanks a lot for any help here.

item.title: [cssom-view-1, dom, pointerlock-2, pointerevents3, fullscreen, DOM-Parsing] [WebAPI] Implement Element.setHTML(input, sanitizer)
item.content:encoded:
Acceptance Criteria

  • The listed features are documented sufficiently on MDN
  • BCD is updated
  • Interactive example and data repos are updated if appropriate
  • The content has been reviewed as needed

For folks helping with Firefox related documentation

  • Set bugs to dev-doc-complete
  • Add entry to Firefox release notes if feature is enabled in release
    or
  • Add entry to Firefox experimental features page if feature is not yet enabled in release

Features to document

implement Element.setHTML(input, sanitizer). New method page under https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element

Related Gecko bugs

https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1716624

item.title: [html, cssom-view-1, dom, uievents, WebIDL-1, FileAPI, pointerlock-2] Remove alert() from live samples
item.content:encoded:
window.alert() doesn't work cross-origin in Chrome any more, meaning that any of our live samples that rely on alert() are now broken.

See also #7553.

This is (I think) all the live samples in Web/API that use alert() in a live sample:

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/attr/localname
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/canvasrenderingcontext2d/addhitregion
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/document/querycommandstate
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/domexception/domexception
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/eventlistener
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/eventtarget/addeventlistener
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/file/name
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/keyboardevent/metakey
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/mouseevent
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/notifications_api/using_the_notifications_api
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/window/find
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/windoworworkerglobalscope/settimeout (fixed in #7560)

(I might have missed some).

We should replace all of these with some alternative. A common alternative is to write the output into an element in the example's document.
